onboarding.title: Getting Started — Onboarding Guide
onboarding.description: Important information about your website launch, access, and what to expect.
onboarding.ctaDescription: Everything you need to know before and after your website launch — timeline, access, legal, support, and handoff.

whereWeAre.title: Where We Are Now
whereWeAre.content: You are currently in the Pre-Launch Phase. You have received access to the test server, CMS invitation (if included), review access to the full website, and the final invoice (2–5 business days before launch). Launch means your website becomes live and accessible through your domain.

launchTimeline.title: Launch Timeline
launchTimeline.beforeLaunch: Before launch, you review all page content, contact details, images, legal pages, forms, navigation, and SEO fields. You confirm approval. Final payment is due on launch day.
launchTimeline.launchDay: On launch day, the website goes live on your domain. SSL is active, hosting is monitored, analytics tracking is active (if included), and all deliverables are handed over.
launchTimeline.afterLaunch: After launch, you enter a 2-week support window. This includes small text edits, image replacements, typo corrections, and contact info adjustments. It does not include new pages, layout changes, design adjustments, or new features. Major changes require a new agreement or support plan.

accessCredentials.title: Access & Credentials
accessCredentials.cms: CMS invitations are sent by email. Editors can add and delete content. Writers can add content only. Content recovery is not guaranteed. You are responsible for managing your own content.
accessCredentials.email: Initial password is provided by Eye On Idea. You must change it after first login. Email hosting is EU-based. Backups are your responsibility. Eye On Idea does not retain mailbox access.
accessCredentials.domain: Domain is registered in your company name. You are the legal owner. Renewal is yearly. Renewal reminders are sent in advance. Failure to renew may result in expiration.
accessCredentials.hosting: Website is hosted in Europe. SSL is active. Weekly uptime checks are performed. FTP/server access is not provided by default. DNS records can be provided upon request.

legalCompliance.title: Legal & Compliance
legalCompliance.content: Eye On Idea provides a Privacy Policy, Cookie Policy, and cookie banner configuration (industry standard wording). Terms & Conditions must be discussed and approved during the project. GDPR compliance is structured according to standard EU law context. If EU legislation changes in the future, Eye On Idea may update relevant policies accordingly.

seoExpectations.title: SEO & Expectations
seoExpectations.content: Your website is built to achieve 90+ Lighthouse performance score, follow semantic structure best practices, and support technical SEO standards. Eye On Idea does not guarantee search rankings. Search engine ranking services are outside scope and require a specialist.

monitoring.title: Monitoring & Maintenance
monitoring.content: After launch, weekly uptime checks are performed, critical security issues will be addressed if discovered, and compatibility updates are performed only when necessary. Ongoing optimization and extended support require a support plan.

launchChecklist.title: Launch Checklist
launchChecklist.note: Launch confirms approval of delivered work.

supportWindow.title: Support Window
supportWindow.content: The 2-week support period is designed to catch small corrections. It does not include redesign, feature expansion, new page creation, or structural changes. After the support window, further work requires a new agreement or support plan.

handoff.title: Handoff & Ownership
handoff.content: Upon full and final payment, intellectual property of custom work transfers to you. Static website files can be delivered upon request. Brand assets can be re-delivered for active clients. Pre-existing frameworks and reusable systems remain property of Eye On Idea.

communication.title: Communication
communication.content: Primary contact channels are email and phone. Response times depend on current workload unless a support plan is active.

cmsOverview.introText: Your CMS (Content Management System) is the place where you manage your website's content. It does not require coding.
cmsOverview.whatYouCanDo1: Update text and images on your website
cmsOverview.whatYouCanDo2: Create and publish news or posts (if included in your project)
cmsOverview.whatYouCanDo4: Keep your website up to date without touching code
cmsOverview.prerequisitesTitle: What you need before you start
cmsOverview.prerequisitesText: To access the CMS, you need an invitation email from Eye On Idea. You will provide the email addresses that should get access and specify who should be Editor vs Writer (if relevant).
cmsOverview.rolesWriter: Writer: Can add content (limited editing and removal capabilities)
cmsOverview.rolesEditor: Editor: Can add, edit, and delete content
cmsOverview.rolesNote: Eye On Idea retains Admin access to protect the technical setup. Clients do not receive schema access.
cmsOverview.tip: If you are unsure about something, save a draft first. In normal use, you cannot break the website by editing content.

loggingIn.openStudioText: Your content studio is a web application accessed through your browser. Go to your Studio link, usually:
loggingIn.openStudioBookmark: Bookmark this URL for quick access in the future.
loggingIn.signInStep1: Click Sign in on the studio page
loggingIn.signInStep2: Use the email address you were invited with
loggingIn.noInviteText: Ask your company admin to confirm your email address, or contact Eye On Idea directly to resend the invitation.
loggingIn.tip: If the invitation link has expired, contact your Eye On Idea project manager to request a new one.

studioNavigation.introText: Most studios have a left-side menu with content types. These typically include:
studioNavigation.howToNavigate: Click the area you want to update. Use the search feature if it is available to find specific content quickly.
studioNavigation.tip: If you don't see a navigation sidebar, look for a menu icon (often three horizontal lines) at the top of the screen, especially on smaller screens.

editingText.introText: To edit text content in the studio, click into a text field, make your changes, and keep sentences short and clear.
editingText.step1: Click into the text field you want to change
editingText.step2: Make your edits directly in the field
editingText.step3: Keep sentences short and clear for readability
editingText.pastingText: Avoid pasting text with formatting from Word or other editors. If you paste, quickly re-check spacing and headings to ensure they look correct.
editingText.tip: Use the built-in formatting tools (headings, bold, lists) rather than trying to format manually with spaces or special characters.
editingText.warning: Some content may be locked to protect the website structure. Only Eye On Idea changes the schema and studio setup.

draftsAndPublishing.draftsText: Drafts save automatically in most studios. Use drafts when you are not done yet, want someone else to review, or are unsure about the final wording.
draftsAndPublishing.publishStep1: Click Publish when you are ready
draftsAndPublishing.publishStep3: The website will update automatically — it may take a short time before changes appear
draftsAndPublishing.checkText: After publishing, open the page on your live website and verify:
draftsAndPublishing.tip: If you do not see your changes, try a hard refresh: Cmd+Shift+R (Mac) or Ctrl+Shift+R (Windows).
draftsAndPublishing.warning: Deleting content is often permanent. If you are unsure, save a draft or contact Eye On Idea before deleting anything.

seoBasics.introText: SEO fields control how your pages appear in search engine results and social media previews. They do not change visible website text.
seoBasics.field1: SEO Title — the page title shown in Google results
seoBasics.field2: Meta Description — the short text under the title in Google
seoBasics.field3: Social share image (if included in your project)
seoBasics.titleText: The SEO title appears in Google search results. Keep it 50–60 characters, clear and specific, and include your main topic.
seoBasics.descriptionText: The meta description is the short text under the title in Google. Keep it 120–160 characters, write a clear summary of the page, and invite the user to click.
seoBasics.descriptionExample: Example: "Professional roofing solutions for businesses in Aarhus. Get expert advice and a free consultation."
seoBasics.note: SEO does not guarantee rankings. Clear structure matters more than keyword stuffing. Keep it simple and human.

slugsAndUrls.introText: The slug is the page address that appears in the browser URL bar.
slugsAndUrls.publishText: After updating SEO fields, click Publish. Changes take effect after the website rebuilds.
slugsAndUrls.warning: Avoid changing a slug after publishing unless necessary. Changing a slug changes the page URL, which can break existing links and bookmarks.
slugsAndUrls.note: Every page should have SEO fields filled in. Empty SEO fields mean search engines have less information about your page.

creatingAPost.introText: Your news or posts section lets you share updates, publish articles, improve visibility in search engines, and keep your website active. Each post becomes its own page.
creatingAPost.createStep2: Click News or Posts in the navigation
creatingAPost.titleText: Write a clear, short, and specific title. Avoid very long titles, all caps, or keyword stuffing.
creatingAPost.imageStep2: Upload a new image or select an existing one
creatingAPost.imageTip: Use landscape format unless otherwise stated in the help text.
creatingAPost.contentText: Use headings to structure your text. A good structure includes an introduction, main section, supporting details, and a conclusion. Keep paragraphs short and avoid long blocks of text.

publishingAPost.draftText: Draft saves automatically. You can leave and return later. Use a draft if you are not finished or want internal approval first.
publishingAPost.publishText: Click Publish when ready. After publishing, the post becomes visible on your website and appears in your news overview page.
publishingAPost.tip: You can edit a post after publishing. Simply make your changes and publish again.
publishingAPost.note: Deleting a post removes it permanently. If scheduling is enabled in your project, you can schedule posts for future publication.

imageBestPractices.introText: Good images make your website look professional. Poor images can slow it down or make it look unclear. The studio shows recommended sizes — follow them.
imageBestPractices.prepare2: Use PNG only if you need transparency
imageBestPractices.prepare3: Keep file size under 1–2 MB unless otherwise stated
imageBestPractices.prepare4: Resize images close to the recommended size shown in the studio
imageBestPractices.uploadStep2: Upload or choose from existing media
imageBestPractices.uploadStep3: Wait for the upload to finish
imageBestPractices.uploadWarning: Avoid uploading screenshots from WhatsApp, very small images stretched large, or images with embedded text (unless intentional).
imageBestPractices.cropText: Make sure the subject is centered, important text is not cut off, and faces are not cropped at the top. Always check how it looks on the website.
imageBestPractices.tip: When in doubt, use landscape images unless told otherwise.

altTextAndFiles.altTextText: Alt text describes the image. It helps with accessibility, search engines, and screen readers. Keep it short and descriptive.
altTextAndFiles.altTextGood: Good example: "Commercial roofing team installing flat roof in Aarhus"
altTextAndFiles.publishText: After publishing, open the page on your website and check desktop view, mobile view, and loading speed. If it feels slow, the image may be too large.
altTextAndFiles.filesText: If your studio allows file uploads, follow these guidelines:
altTextAndFiles.file1: Keep PDFs under 5 MB if possible
altTextAndFiles.warning: Alt text is important for accessibility (WCAG compliance). Always fill it in when the field is available.

commonMistakes.introText: Here are the most frequent mistakes when working with your CMS, and how to avoid them.
commonMistakes.cms1Text: Deleting is often permanent. If you are unsure, save a draft or ask Eye On Idea before deleting.
commonMistakes.cms2Text: Images over 5 MB slow down the page. Use the recommended sizes shown in the studio help text.
commonMistakes.cms3Text: Menus behave differently on mobile. Always check both desktop and mobile views after changes.
commonMistakes.cms4Text: This can introduce hidden formatting. Re-check spacing and headings after pasting.
commonMistakes.cms5Text: Use headings and short paragraphs. Break up long blocks of text for readability.
commonMistakes.cms6Text: Always check how content looks on the live website before considering it final.
commonMistakes.cms7Text: Repeating words unnaturally harms clarity. Write for humans first.
commonMistakes.cms8Text: Always fill in SEO title and meta description. Empty fields give search engines less information.
commonMistakes.cms9Text: Alt text is important for accessibility and search engines. Always fill it in.

cmsFaq.q1: Where do I edit my website content?
cmsFaq.a1: In your CMS Studio, usually at studio.yourdomain.com.
cmsFaq.q2: Can I break the website by editing content?
cmsFaq.a2: In normal use, no. You can change text, images, and content blocks safely. Avoid deleting content, unpublishing key pages, or replacing images with very large files. If unsure, save a draft first.
cmsFaq.q3: Why can't I edit certain things?
cmsFaq.a3: Some content is locked to protect the structure. Only Eye On Idea changes the schema and studio setup.
cmsFaq.q4: I can't log in. What do I do?
cmsFaq.a4: Confirm you are using the invited email address, check your spam folder for the invitation, or ask Eye On Idea to resend the invite.
cmsFaq.q5: When do changes show on the website?
cmsFaq.a5: Usually within a short time after you publish. Your website rebuilds automatically when content is published.
cmsFaq.a6: If scheduling is enabled in your studio, yes. If not, Eye On Idea can add it in some setups.
cmsFaq.q7: Does SEO guarantee first place in Google?
cmsFaq.a7: No. SEO improves clarity and structure. Ranking depends on many external factors.
cmsFaq.q8: Does the system compress images automatically?
cmsFaq.a8: Yes. The website optimises images when displaying them. Still, start with reasonable sizes.
cmsFaq.q9: Can Eye On Idea help with content and SEO?
cmsFaq.a9: Yes. Content improvement, image optimisation, and SEO audits are available as additional services.

emailOverview.introText: Your email address (e.g., name{'@'}yourdomain.com) is provided as part of your website setup. It runs on a professional email system called Zimbra.
emailOverview.feature1: Secure email hosting in the EU
emailOverview.feature3: IMAP support for apps (Outlook, Apple Mail, Thunderbird, mobile)
emailOverview.eoi4: Manages account creation, deletion, or upgrades
emailOverview.your1: Changing your password after first login
emailOverview.warning: Eye On Idea does not retain access to your mailbox after delivery.

firstLogin.step3: Log in with your full email address and the password provided to you
firstLogin.changeStep1: Go to account settings after logging in
firstLogin.changeStep2: Change your password to something secure
firstLogin.changeStep3: Store it securely (use a password manager if possible)
firstLogin.warning: Always change your initial password immediately after first login. This protects your mailbox from unauthorised access.

webmailAccess.introText: Webmail allows you to access your email directly through a browser without installing any apps.
webmailAccess.featuresTitle: What you can do with webmail
webmailAccess.feature3: Use built-in calendar and contacts (if enabled)
webmailAccess.accessText: Go to https://zimbra1.mail.ovh.net/ and sign in with your email address and password.
webmailAccess.note: You can use webmail only, or also connect an email app. Both work simultaneously.

emailAppSetup.introText: Most users prefer using an email app instead of or in addition to webmail. Use the IMAP settings below.
emailAppSetup.appsText: Use these settings in Outlook, Apple Mail, Thunderbird, or your iPhone/Android mail app.
emailAppSetup.testStep1: Send a test email to yourself
emailAppSetup.testStep2: Confirm it appears in your inbox
emailAppSetup.tip: If something fails, double-check server names, confirm correct ports, and ensure SSL is enabled.
emailAppSetup.warning: Always use IMAP, not POP. IMAP keeps all your devices synced. POP may cause messages to disappear from other devices.

emailBackup.introText: Eye On Idea does not provide mailbox backups. If backups are important for your business, you should set them up yourself.
emailBackup.option1: Enable local mail storage in your email client
emailBackup.option2: Export mail periodically to a local archive
emailBackup.option3: Use professional backup software if required
emailBackup.warning: Email data can be lost due to accidental deletion, account issues, or security incidents. Regular backups protect your business communications.

emailFaq.a1: Your mailbox data is stored in European data centres (France and Germany), helping you comply with GDPR.
emailFaq.q2: Can Eye On Idea read my emails?
emailFaq.a2: No. Eye On Idea does not have mailbox access after setup. We only manage account structure (create, delete, upgrade accounts).
emailFaq.q3: Can I create additional email addresses?
emailFaq.a3: Yes. Contact Eye On Idea to create new accounts or aliases.
emailFaq.a4: Yes. Storage upgrades can be arranged if needed.
emailFaq.mistake1: Not changing the initial password — always change it immediately
emailFaq.mistake2: Using POP instead of IMAP — IMAP keeps devices synced
emailFaq.mistake3: Sharing passwords by email — never send passwords via unsecured channels

domainOwnership.introText: Your domain is your digital address (e.g., yourdomain.com). It connects your website, email, and other online services.
domainOwnership.ownershipText: Your domain is registered in your company's name and legally owned by your company. Eye On Idea manages it administratively but you remain the legal owner at all times.
domainOwnership.eoi1: Registers the domain in your company's name
domainOwnership.your3: Informing us if company details change

domainRenewal.processText: Domains renew yearly. The process is straightforward:
domainRenewal.processStep1: One month before renewal, Eye On Idea contacts you
domainRenewal.expirationText: In the final month before expiration, weekly reminders are sent. Contact attempts may include phone and email.
domainRenewal.warning: If no response is received before expiration, the domain may expire, become publicly available, and your website and email may stop working. Eye On Idea does not retain ownership of expired domains.
domainRenewal.lifecycle1: Active — your domain is working normally
domainRenewal.lifecycle3: Grace period — may still be recoverable
domainRenewal.lifecycle4: Redemption period — recovery involves additional fees
domainRenewal.lifecycle5: Released — domain becomes available for anyone to register
domainRenewal.tip: To avoid any risk, always renew before expiration.

domainTransfer.introText: You can transfer your domain to another provider at any time. Eye On Idea does not block domain transfers. The domain belongs to you.
domainTransfer.processStep1: Written confirmation from the domain owner is required
domainTransfer.processStep2: Transfer code (auth code) is provided by Eye On Idea
domainTransfer.processStep3: The new provider handles the transfer from there
domainTransfer.note: Transfers are coordinated to avoid downtime. Contact Eye On Idea to start the process.

dnsConfiguration.introText: DNS (Domain Name System) controls how your domain connects to your website, email, and other services. Eye On Idea manages these settings.
dnsConfiguration.warning: We recommend not changing DNS settings without coordination, as it may interrupt website access, email delivery, or security certificates.

domainFaq.a1: Yes. The domain is registered in your company's name. You are the legal owner.
domainFaq.q2: Can Eye On Idea take my domain?
domainFaq.a2: No. You are the legal owner at all times.
domainFaq.q3: What happens if I forget to renew?
domainFaq.a3: The domain may expire and eventually become available for others to register.
domainFaq.a4: Yes. Additional domains can be registered for brand protection, multiple markets, or campaign use.
domainFaq.q5: Can I move my domain to another provider?
domainFaq.a5: Yes. Transfer is possible at any time with written confirmation.

hostingSetup.introText: Your website is hosted on European infrastructure. It is built as a performance-focused static website, which means fast loading, high security, low maintenance risk, and no public server login required.
hostingSetup.eoi1: Deploys and maintains the production website
hostingSetup.eoi5: Ensures website rebuild after content updates
hostingSetup.note: Hosting access (FTP or control panel) is not provided by default. This ensures stability, security, and clear responsibility. If you require special access, this must be agreed in writing.

environments.productionText: Your live website is hosted in Europe, uses secure SSL, is optimised for performance, and is monitored for availability. You do not need to access this environment.
environments.developmentText: During development, a temporary development environment is created. You may receive access to preview progress. This environment is removed after launch.
environments.note: The development environment is not public infrastructure. It may not have had constant uptime during the project. Production hosting is stable and monitored.

contentUpdates.introText: When you publish content in your CMS, the website updates automatically. You do not need to manually upload files.
contentUpdates.processStep1: You publish content in the CMS
contentUpdates.processStep4: The updated version replaces the previous one
contentUpdates.tip: Changes may take a few minutes to appear due to the rebuild process. If changes don't appear after several minutes, try a hard refresh or contact your project manager.

analyticsReporting.introText: Your website can include analytics tracking to help you understand visitor behaviour.
analyticsReporting.note: Reporting structure may evolve as Eye On Idea improves its analytics system. If you require structured reporting or KPI tracking, this can be added as a service.

supportAndMaintenance.basicText: Basic maintenance is included and covers:
supportAndMaintenance.extendedText: Extended maintenance is available through support packages, which may include:
supportAndMaintenance.accessText: By default, no FTP access or hosting control panel access is provided. This ensures stability, security, and clear responsibility. DNS record lists can be provided upon request.

hostingFaq.a1: Not by default. External access can affect stability and security.
hostingFaq.q2: What happens if the website goes down?
hostingFaq.a2: Eye On Idea monitors uptime. If an issue is detected, it is investigated and resolved.
hostingFaq.q3: Is the hosting in the EU?
hostingFaq.a3: Yes. Hosting infrastructure is based in Europe.
hostingFaq.a4: Yes. Hosting can be transferred upon written request. The process will be coordinated to avoid downtime.

logoFiles.introText: You received multiple versions of your logo in different formats. Each format has a specific purpose.
logoFiles.svgText: Best for website, large prints, professional printing, and scaling to any size. Never loses quality. This is your most versatile logo file.
logoFiles.pngText: Best for social media, presentations, documents, and transparent backgrounds. Good for digital use.
logoFiles.jpgText: Best for simple digital sharing and email attachments. Not ideal for printing due to compression.
logoFiles.tip: When in doubt, use SVG for professional use and PNG for everyday digital use.

logoUsage.versionsText: You may have received several logo versions:
logoUsage.version1: Primary logo — use this by default
logoUsage.version4: Icon-only version — for social media profile pictures and small spaces
logoUsage.rulesText: Use the primary logo by default. Use variations only when space is limited, background requires contrast, or a social media profile picture needs the icon-only version.
logoUsage.warning: If unsure about logo usage, ask Eye On Idea before making changes.

colorsAndTypography.colorsText: Your brand includes defined colors. Use the primary color for main highlights, secondary colors for support, and neutral colors for backgrounds.
colorsAndTypography.colorsAvoid: Avoid random new colors or overuse of strong accent colours. If unsure, follow your brand guide PDF.
colorsAndTypography.typographyText: If fonts were delivered, use the defined primary font for headings and the secondary font for body text. If the brand includes system-safe alternatives, use those in email or internal documents.
colorsAndTypography.warning: Do not mix random fonts. Consistent typography is essential for brand recognition.

templatesAndPrint.businessCardsText: Delivered as print-ready PDF and digital formats. For printing, send the print-ready PDF directly to the printer. Do not modify bleed or margins.
templatesAndPrint.letterheadText: Use the official template with correct logo placement and spacing. Avoid resizing elements.
templatesAndPrint.presentationsText: Delivered as PPTX file (possibly with PDF version). Use master slides, predefined layouts, and correct font styles. Do not insert different fonts or change layout structure.
templatesAndPrint.socialMediaText: Includes profile image templates, post templates, and highlight covers (if included). Use these to maintain visual consistency across platforms.

brandConsistency.introText: Consistency builds recognition. Inconsistent branding looks unprofessional, confuses customers, and weakens trust.
brandConsistency.check1: Does this follow our brand guide?
brandConsistency.check2: Does it look like our website?
brandConsistency.checkText: If not, adjust before publishing or sharing.
brandConsistency.fileManagement1: Store brand assets in one shared company folder
brandConsistency.fileManagement4: Never edit the original master files
brandConsistency.warning: Using screenshots of your logo, mixing brand colors with random shades, or uploading low-quality assets undermines your professional image.

visualIdentityFaq.q1: Which logo file should I send to a printer?
visualIdentityFaq.a1: Use the SVG or the print-ready PDF. Never send a JPG to a printer.
visualIdentityFaq.a2: Only as part of a formal rebranding process.
visualIdentityFaq.q3: Can Eye On Idea create additional brand assets?
visualIdentityFaq.a3: Yes. Extended brand services are available.
visualIdentityFaq.q4: What if I lose the files?
visualIdentityFaq.a4: Contact Eye On Idea for re-delivery.
visualIdentityFaq.mistake1: Sending JPG to printer — use vector files or print-ready PDFs
visualIdentityFaq.mistake2: Using a screenshot of the logo — never use screenshots
visualIdentityFaq.mistake3: Mixing brand colors with random shades — stick to the defined palette
visualIdentityFaq.mistake4: Uploading low-quality logo to social media — use the high-resolution PNG provided
